intro: Sageraea elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic sageraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streambanks. Sageraea elliptica is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
